TopicTitle: [Links] Flag builder and generator tool thread!

Articles.Content:
In this thread, I ask that you post links to websites that have flag generators--or free to use flag generating programs.

(Illegal torrents to a normally paid-for program do not count as free, and might earn you a forum ban, so don't do it.)

List so far:

http://flag-designer.appspot.com/#d=2&c1=2&c2=1&c3=5&o=4&c4=3&s=9&c5=1 (My personal favorite.)

http://www.gimp.org/downloads/ (Not technically a flag generator, but a very good free image editor that will help you refine your creations, or build them from scratch)

http://www.openprocessing.org/sketch/23662 (Random flag generator. No editing capability--but good if you need inspiration.)

http://ribbons.cgagnier.ca/ (dead link)

http://www.wordle.net/ (Wordle is a toy for generating “word clouds” from text that you provide, which can make neat flags.)

More to come if people can provide sources!

Gimp is your friend!

When setting up to crop & scale an image for your flag, I suggest using the rectangle select tool. Lock the aspect ratio, and put in either 256:160 or 160:256 (depending on if you want the crop window horizontal or vertical. Remember to transform the image to horizontal before saving

You may want to do an unsharp mask before scaling, and recall that simple = better as those small details will turn to mud.

Even better, do the work in something like inkscape first!
